heading: HB08388
0: AN ACT INSTITUTING THE FARMERS AND FISHERFOLK ENTERPRISE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM OF THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES
mother-bill statusstatus: Republic Act RA11321 enacted on 2019-04-17 Substituted by HB08857
history:
House Bill/Resolution NO. HB08388
FULL TITLE : AN ACT INSTITUTING THE FARMERS AND FISHERFOLK ENTERPRISE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM OF THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES
ABSTRACT : Seeks to capacitate our agricultural and fisher-folk communities through an enterprise development program that will provide assistance to farmers and fishermen in developing their own business through various opportunities to develop technical skills, use production equipment and facilities, gain access to credit, and avail of business development counselling services. Proposes to establish a comprehensive and holistic approach in the formulation, coordination and implementation of enterprise development initiatives, consolidate the roles of different government agencies involved therein, intensify the building of entrepreneurship culture among farmers and fisherfolk, and provide incentives to private entities that support said initiatives of the government.
ALIAS NAME : "Sagip Saka Act of 2018"
PRINCIPAL AUTHOR/S : ALEJANO, GARY C.
DATE FILED : 2018-10-08
SIGNIFICANCE: NATIONAL
ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE
MOTHER BILL: HB08857
ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE ON RULES
REFERRAL TO THE COMMITTEE ON AGRICULTURE AND FOOD ON 2018-10-10
